title.narrative: Capacity Building & ASA Community Driven Development Pilot – 2015

description.narrative: 1.1 DEVELOP: Formal documentation of Lebombo admin, finance and human resource policies and procedures.,1.2 TRAIN: Training of diocesan staff (including ASA) in new administration, finance and human resource procedures.,1.3 ACCOMPANY: Mentoring of diocesan staff (including ASA) in administration, finance and human resource procedures.,1.4 CONFIRM: Mentoring and monitoring of diocesan progress toward more professional administration, finance and human resource procedures.,2.1 LEARN: Peer exchange learning visit to Mozambican organizations applying the Church and Community Mobilization Process (CCMP) and their self-directed community groups.,2.2 NETWORK: Leadership learning and network building at the CAPA-sponsored CCMP Gathering of Trainers in Kenya (Aug 10-15,2015).,2.3 TRAIN: CCMP (Umoja and Theology & Development) phase 1 training for ASA staff, diocesan leadership, archdeaconry representatives and community facilitators.,2.4 APPLY: Pilot application of CCMP methodology and tools in an estimated 14 communities (representing at least one community per newly trained CCMP Facilitator); Facilitate communities in the identification of their assets, dreams (goals) and action plans for their own community-driven development.

In 2014, the Lebombo Diocese consecrated the Right Reverend Carlos Simão Matsinhe as its 11th Bishop. With an intention to build upon the strengths of both the Diocese and its relief and development office known as Anglican Social Action (ASA), Bishop Matsinhe with the support of Episcopal Relief & Development has chosen 2015 to be a year of learning and growth. To this end, Episcopal Relief & Development will be partnering with Lebombo on two key initiatives: 1) Lebombo Diocese Capacity Building in administration, finance and human resource policies and practices, and 2) ASA Community Driven Development through the application of a pilot Church and Community Mobilization Process (CCMP) known as Umoja (Together we Can).
